Judul: EFFECT OF ETHANOLIC EXTRACT OF PINE NEEDLE(PINUS MERKUSII) AND BAMBOO LEAF(PHYLLOSTACHYS BAMBUSOIDES) ON DNCB INDUCED ATOPICDERMATITIS IN BALB/c MICE MODEL
Abstrak:
Prevalence of allergic disease is increasing according to the increment of factors which can
act as an allergent such as dust, dust mites, food, as the result of industrialization and
urbanization. Atopic dermatitis is a type IV or delayed type hypersensitivity which is
mediated mainly by T helper cell which is known to produce many cytokines and chemokines
that induces inflammatory response. Pinus merkusii and Phyllostachys bambusoides, its
astonishing anti-inflammatory effect is recorded in the Dongui-bogam and Shénnóng B?n
C?o J?ng which are famous book of Eastern traditional medicine from Korea and China.
This research was done to investigate the anti-atopic dermatitis potential of ethanolic extract
of Pinus merkusii and Phyllostachys bambusoides leaves on female BALB/c mice. The atopic
dermatitis was developed on female BALB/c mice by applying 2,4-dinitrochlorobenzene 0.2
and 2 % on the back of the skin of mice which are shaved 24 hours before the induction.
Leaves of Pinus merkusii and Phyllostachys bambusoides was extracted by maceration
method using ethanol and methanol accordingly as a solvent. Concentrated extract using
rotary evaporator is then prepared into three dose of each plant that are 0.5, 1, and 5 % using
ethanol 70%. It was applied on mice with dose of 200?l/day. The parameter that is
determined was dermatitis scoring, organ index, thickness of epidermis, mast cell count, and
concentration of IFN-gamma. Based on the scoring of the atopic dermatitis, after 21days of
application of extracts, all the treated groups showed lower score compared to the positive
control group. Qualitative evaluation of hair density showed that the hair density of treated
group was close to the normal except standard group. Organ index were still lower, indicating
that it needs further treatment in order to return to original condition. From the
histopathological analysis those concentration of extracts are able to reduce in thickness and
number of the mast cell on epidermis. The lowest reduction in thickness of epidermis and
mast cell count occur after treated with PBE 5% with value of thickness (28.58?m) and mast
cell count (6.6±1.13). All concentration of test extract can reduce IFN-gamma level (p<0.1).
Lowest reduction was shown in group PME 5% (21.28±3.68pg/mL). The leaves of Pinus
merkusii and Phyllostachys bambusoides has the potential to be further developed as anti-
atopic dermatitis agent.
